title: Credito Real Bonds Sink on Accounting Concerns
sub_head: Mexico’s largest nonbank lender told analysts that its better-than-expected third-quarter results were due, in part, to an accounting change that wasn’t publicly disclosed
body:
Bonds backing Mexican nonbank lender Credito Real S.A.B. de C.V. fell as much as 11% last week after the company said in a private call that higher interest margins in the third quarter were due to an accounting change that the company hadn’t publicly disclosed.
Credito Real is the largest company in Mexico’s shadow banking sector, with a focus on lending to individuals and businesses that traditional banks in Mexico don’t serve.
